content: “Rowing harder doesn’t help when your boat is heading in the wrong direction.” Less than 5% figured out the right direction.It is ridiculously hard for people with “normal” intelligence to understand problems of people with very high intelligence. First of all — isolation. Most of us would not want to be around people with IQ 70 (that’s classified as a disability). To people with IQ of 130+ “normals” look pretty much the same. Imagine that you can have a proper discussion with only 1 person out of 100, that’ll be hard, right? Having high intelligence will only make things more difficult, not easier.
